5e89017b0bd0.title: Thanks Guy, a useful quick reference.

paragraphs.text: Thanks Guy, a useful quick reference. A finickity point… A/B Testing is where a single element is changed and tested (e.g. the colour of a call-to-action button changed from Red to Green to understand click through rate). If more than one element is changed it becomes Multivariate Testing. Cheers, Rikki
paragraphs.name: 08f8

paragraphs.text: Hi! That’s really useful. Thank you :)
I’d add more terms such as User study, User research, User story, Case study, QA, Alpha/Beta versions, Prototype, Paas, Iass etc. :)

3212673d8ef2.title: This is a good list, but I’m not sure A/B testing is about ‘which one they prefer’.

paragraphs.text: This is a good list, but I’m not sure A/B testing is about ‘which one they prefer’. It’s about testing one version against another to see which better hits predefined metrics, such as conversion. There’s normally not a user vote attached.
paragraphs.name: dd54

paragraphs.text: Anyway, carry on, just being picky.

virtuals.subtitle: Anyway, carry on, just being picky.

content.subtitle: Anyway, carry on, just being picky.

paragraphs.text: Hi, that is so great. That is exactly I wrote it. Bookmark it and come back to it. Once you know it all get rid of the bookmark. Enjoy and good luck on your learning.
